content:
TemplateInstance Enum

Definition

Specifies how many times an instance of a template can be created.

In this Article

public enum TemplateInstance
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
System.Enum
TemplateInstance

Remarks

The TemplateInstance enumeration specifies values indicating the number of times an instance of a template can be created. The ttribute class uses values from the TemplateInstance enumeration. In particular, the ttribute.Single and ttribute.Multiple fields specify single and multiple instances of a template, respectively. A single instance of a template allows you to reference controls that are contained within the template.

Examples of controls that use the Single value in property metadata include the ZoneTemplate property of the CatalogZone control, the ZoneTemplate property of the EditorZone control, and the ZoneTemplate property of the WebPartZone.

Fields

Multiple

A template that is instantiated multiple times.
Single

A template that is instantiated only one time.
